reviews.review: Amazing story!
Fantastic game, Wish there was a sequal.

Half-Life: Opposing Force

Positives:
+ good sound/music atmosphere
+ nice gunplay
+ some cool levels
+ ok length
+ the few places that are outside
+ good AI for its time
+ the puzzles
+ new weapons and enemies
+ cool to see the story from another angle

Negatives:
- some of the levels are not good enough
- difficulty spikes
- not as good as the original
- no graphical improvement

Total Score: 7/10

preciosura

Not finished with the game yet but I thought I would just write the review since Im at the end and I dont think much will change that will effect my overall thoughts on the game.

I am very conflicted on whether or not I enjoy this expansion for a few reasons, the main one being: its too damn difficult. Its to the point of unfairness. Granted I am playing on Hard but its just stupid. A good majority of the enemies are humans with guns that take half a mag from your SMG to kill and while your trying to chase one down three more will be pounding you with grenades while another one sprints up to you and unloads before you can even look at him. The first few times it happens its an intense rush and extremely satisfying when you finally clear the room but now Im at the point where Im about 4 hours into this and Im still fighting them and its just frustrating and grueling at this point and I just want the game to end. Whenever you think you finally hit the end, you go down a vent and then another chapter begins full of the same 6 enemies to fight over and over maybe with a boss fight sprinkled in, which I will say are pretty fun sections. On the other hand, Blue Shift can be beaten in about 3 hours and manages to keep doing different things to keep the gameplay fresh throughout that time and this is where Opposing Force falls flat on its face for me. Dont get me wrong I still have fun for a good portion of the game but as I said before, its dragging on far too long in my opinion and it doesnt have enough gameplay variety to make it fun passed the 3 hour mark.

This is one of those times where I wish steam had a "meh" button but because it doesnt I'll just recommend it because I truly do think its a good expansion for HL1 but when compared to the OG game and Blue Shift it really doesnt compare for me.

6.6/10


EDIT: Just beat it and as I expected theres nothing that really changes my original thoughts on the game. Final boss was pretty lackluster but besides that it was a neat ending.

Es bueno aunque tiene algunos bugs, la IA es una esponja de balas cuando se trata de tus compañeros y aveces hasta te matan aunque dejando de lado eso esta para hecharse una rica viciada, tengo 7 horas registradas y solo lo he jugado 1 ocasion.

Game's got a few new things for you. There's somethings setting Adrian apart from Gordon. My favorite detail is that Adrian holds his SMG and reloads it differently than Gordon. He also draws it faster. You get a few new toys. 1. No crowbar. You get a pipe wrench that's better than it IMO. It can be charged up for stronger hits. This weapon is godly at the beginning of the game. Got a Vort after you? Hide and charge the secondary fire. When he comes around, bash his stupid headcrab jambalaya-eating brains in. If you still need a fast hitting weapon, you got a combat knife. 2. Instead of a revolver, you get a Desert Eagle with laser sights. 3. No crossbow. You get a sniper rifle. 4. You get a goddamned SAW Machine Gun. The kickback on it is so big that it pushes you backwards. 5. No Hivehand. You get 3 new alien weapons though. 6. No Tau Cannon or Gluon Gun. Displacer Cannon instead. Teleports enemies into Xen on M1. M2 to teleport yourself away. Certain places will get you supplies if you teleport from there. M1 costs 20 Uranium-235. M2 costs 40. You get some soldiers to help you. A shotgunner, a SMG soldier, and a SAW soldier. You also get a Medic, and an Engineer who looks like Kurt Russel's RJ MacReady, who uses a blowtorch to kick doors down. I haven't mentioned yet that you can KILL GORDON FREEMAN. You get a game over for doing so, but's fun as hell.

Opposing Forces is a great expansion pack for the original Half-Life since it offers new mechanics, weapons, and monsters. It's anything but more of the same which is what I look for in expansion packs. Furthermore, the campaign is fun and challenging to play through and is reasonable in length. I recommend it!

[h1] Half-Life Opposing Force: [/h1]

Uma das melhores extensões do half life 1 sem duvidas, uma gameplay bem diferente para pessoas que jogaram blue shift e half life 1 com varias armas e formas diferentes de jogar, uma historia bem desenvolvida mostrando que nem todos H.E.C.U é ruim e que tudo foi um engano, lutamos com varios inimigos diferentes do que half life 1, uma variedade bem legal de se ver, infelizmente o jogo tem bastantes bugs (pelo menos pra mim foi) bugs como ficar preso no elevador que acabava forçando me matar para poder prosseguir mas foi bem tranquilo do que "half life blue shift"

Fun fact: Zerei este jogo pela primeira vez no modo HARD, Foi literalmente muito Hard de se jogar, maioria das vezes fiquei com 20 a 18 de vida, raramente fiquei com 30 ou 50, morri bastante pelos inimigos e pelos bugs, mas consegui zerar esta maravilha
Отличный шутер на пару вечеров
oki

This is, at its heart, a classic Half-Life game. A fun adventure with many frustrating points along the way. Enemies sponging up more munitions than a blast-proof wall, platforming with janky GoldSrc physics, dark tunnels with enemies around a corner you couldn't predict.. But it's the kind of frustration that makes you determined to kick the game's ass and see it through to the end. Plus, its narrative is very interesting, and the primary reason I pushed through to the end. And you do feel fulfilled after overcoming it.

If you're not a fan of the "Where the fuck do I go now" kind of game, and felt annoyed at the other Half-Life titles, this one is noticeably more linear, which is something I kind of enjoyed. But do go into it with the knowledge that it's.. rather flawed.

Half-Life: Opposing Force es una muy buena expansión para uno de los mejores videojuegos en la historia ... Half-Life; y sí, logró estar a la altura.
Es disfrutable y presenta una historia que aporta mucho a los sucesos del juego original como a su universo (hablando de franquicia), a pesar de ser una expansión "independiente". Por esa razón lo convierte en un fantástico producto; totalmente recomendado.

Half Life Opposing Force puts you through the eyes of an "enemy". An ordinary soldier forced to do not-so-ordinary things in order to survive. In the game itself we used to fight against the soldiers but now we play as one of them which is really interesting. We are sent in to capture Freeman but as we arrive things quickly get fucked so we are ordered to forget about Freeman and escape with our own lives. As we do this Spec Ops guys enter the facility trying to kill everyone and blow the entire facility up. The DLC is really fun there are new enemies along with new weapons and night vision googles which is super cool.

+New enemies.
+New weapons.
+New equipment which is the night vision its not awesome but its pretty good.
+A few boss battles. Unfortunately one of these "bosses" will become a main enemy that you fight through the games last few missions. Still its pretty cool.

-The last boss battle is not good. Its really boring and repetative. The boss itself looks super cool but fighting against him is kinda boring.
-The 2nd boss you face is not great either. These boss battles are not awful but they are not good either.

Generally the game is pretty much normal Half Life. Run around, collect health, ammo and different guns and kill enemies both human and non-human. With a few boss battles in between just like the main game. The full price 10,50 Turkish Lira is too much. Wait for a discount then buy the game.

Ce jeu est tout simplement le meilleur FPS de tous les temps et je le recommande énormément à ceux qui ont aimé le premier Half-Life.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the pinnacle of expansions. It does everything right for a game meant to expand on the already amazing Half-Life. New weapons mostly feel fantastic to use especially the sniper rifle. New enemies are pretty good too. Most of the time I felt in control of my character, but there are a few parts where you are forced to take damage and there is no way to avoid it. Overall I would call Half-Life: Opposing Force the best expansion to a video game I've ever played. For these reasons I give it a 9/10.

Not nearly half as good as people say. It's a fraction of what the main Half-Life game is.
It's very dumb. It starts well, but goes quickly downhill and it runs out of tricks very early on... the tricks being, crossing paths with familiar locations from different perspective. Those are pretty awesome parts.. but then it only shows how little grasp Gearbox had when trying to replicate Valve geniuses. I think they got it all wrong with all the dumb alien weapons, and forth wall breaking jokes like Valve and Gearbox puzzle. So so dumb... then the Black Ops only shows they were out of ideas in how to implement human enemies. Cover up of the cover up? So so dumb.

The new aliens designs are also very out of touch and look out of place... something you would see in a fan made mod.

Not really worth your time unless you just wanna consume everything Half-Life you can find.

I think people only remember this well because you don't have to go to Xen.. so that can be see as a Pro, while in Blue Shift you very early on have to be in Xen.
I prefer Blue-shift over this, but its still a great half life mod that shows the perspective of the military group assaulting the black mesa facility.

Herkese merhabalar, Half-life serisi sevdiğimiz, tam anlamıyla ikon olan bir oyun. Hikayemizi uzun uzun anlatmama bence gerek yok ancak bilmeyen kişiler de olabilir. Bu sebeple konusundan kısaca bahsetmem gerekirse, Onbaşı Adrian Shephard isimli karakterimiz, Hazardous Environment Combat Unit (HECU) birliğine bağlı bir denizci. Kendisi Black Mesa görevi için haftalar öncesinden eğitime sokuluyor ve zamanı geldiğinde Gordon Freeman'ın peşine düşmek için her asker gibi göreve gönderiliyor. Tabii ki başına aksilikler geliyor ve zamanla ana görevinden sapıp kendi hayatı için savaşıyor. Bence herkesin oynaması ve bilmesi gereken bir oyun. Ayrıca tıpkı Black Mesa gibi remake halini de beklediğimi söyleyebilirim.
